byline.original: By JESSICA SILVER-GREENBERG and BEN PROTESS

abstract: Justice Department court filing states HSBC has been too slow in fulfilling terms of an agreement that allowed bank to avoid criminal prosecution in 2012 for money laundering and doing business with blacklisted nations like Iran; filing faults company for continuing weaknesses in identifying suspicious transactions and for cultivating corporate culture that is resistant to change.
lead_paragraph: Federal prosecutors said in a court filing that HSBC had failed to carry out terms of a do not prosecute agreement after the bank was found facilitating money laundering in 2012.

headline.main: HSBC Is Deemed Slow to Carry Out Changes
headline.print_headline: HSBC Is Deemed Slow to Carry Out Changes

snippet: Federal prosecutors said in a court filing that HSBC had failed to carry out terms of a do not prosecute agreement after the bank was found facilitating money laundering in 2012.
